name: rape seed production | rape seed | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/13545/documentation

This dataset represents the production of 1 kg of rape seeds (wet mass) in the region of Québec. The 2010-2012 average yield is 2067 kg/ha at a moisture content at storage (i.e. dried seeds) of 9%.;This activity was adapted to include the country specific average land use change (LUC) emissions according 2nd edition of the Quantis-modified tool developed by Blonk Consultants 'WFLDB-adapted-Blonk 2014 direct-land-use-change-assessment-tool_2015-05-18a.xlsx', tab. 'Country known & land use unknown'. The size of the emission depends on (i) the relative crop expansion in the country during the last 20 years and (ii) the corresponding, country specific land transformations. The current results are based on the average FAOSTAT data (harvested area) of 2009-2011 and 1989-1991. The weighted average is used which takes into account relative difference in crop expansion into primary forest, secondary forest, grassland, perennial and annual land.

This activity starts with soil cultivation after the harvest of the previous crop.

This activity ends after harvest and drying of seeds at the farm gate.
The dataset includes the inputs of seeds, mineral and organic fertilisers, pesticides and all machine operations and corresponding machine infrastructure and sheds. Machine operations are: soil cultivation, transport of seeds, fertilisers and pesticides to the field (15 km), sowing, fertilisation, weed control, pest and pathogen control, combine-harvesting, transport from field to farm or local drying centre and drying of seeds. Direct field emissions are also included.
No irrigation is involved for rape seeds production in Québec. The use of car, van or pick-up for servicing people, e.g. from farm to field, is not included in the activities.
category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/01:Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities/011:Growing of non-perennial crops/0111:Growing of cereals (except rice), leguminous crops and oil seeds

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: The inventory is modelled for the region of Québec (Canada).
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Transports are modelled with standard distances. Machine usage is modelled with Québec diesel consumptions and field works (Beauregard, 2013) and Swiss machines. Mineral fertilizer types are extrapolated from overall mineral fertilizers sales in Québec (APNC 2011). Organic fertilizer types are extrapolated from animal manure supply data, per region in Québec, communicated by the Ministry of Agriculture (MAPAQ). Data about agricultural management practices are from BPR (2008. Suivi 2007 du Portrait agroenvironnemental des fermes du Québec). Emissions are calculated with standard methods according to ecoinvent documentation (Nemecek and Schnetzer, 2011. '01 crop production-direct field emissions natural resources' v1.2, August 2011, available at https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/File/Reports) and the World Food LCA Database guidelines (Nemecek et al. 2014, available at http://www.quantis-intl.com/microsites/wfldb/), except for : 1) pesticides emitted fractions (modelled using PestLCI 2.0, a global model, considering Québec average conditions for model input parameters, and considering that the degradation/uptake fraction calculated by PestLCI is actually emitted to soil - see the supporting documentation '01 crop production - Québec.pdf' for rationale), 2) phosphorus and phosphate emissions (modelled using ODEP, a Québec model, considering geospatialized weighted average conditions for soil, hydrology, and agricultural management practices), and 3) ammonia emissions from organic fertilizers which are calculated according to Québec conditions and agricultural management practices (coefficients are taken from Parent et Gagné (2010 and 2013 update). Furthermore, an IPCC Tier 2 approach is used for N2O emissions using regional and ecodistrict-based emission factors (Rochette et al., 2008). Due to lack of comprehensive data on pesticides use for Québec, data from a 2008 survey in the neighbouring province of Ontario are used (OMAFRA, 2008). Uncertainty in terms of the variance of the logtransformed data is the default value as provided by the Data Quality Guidelines for ecoinvent v3 (available at http://www.ecoinvent.org/support/documents-and-files/). Details on modelling and calculations are reported in the supporting documentation '01 crop production - Québec.pdf' available on ecoinvent reports web page (<https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/File/Reports>).
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Literature and statistics data, opinions of experts in the field of agricultural production and agroeconomists.

exchanges.description: For boron (B) micro-nutrient supply. Borax (disodium tetraborate) at 21,5% B in its anhydrous form is assumed, as a proxy. The most likely form of boron supply is a commercial sodium borate at about 14% B (CRAAQ, 2010). Any net emission into the environment is not accounted for. See supporting documentation '01 crop production - Québec.pdf' available on ecoinvent reports web page (https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/File/Reports).

exchanges.description: Calculated value. See supporting documentation '01 crop production - Québec.pdf' available on ecoinvent reports web page (https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/File/Reports).

Total amount of active substance/s of fertilisers needed for the production of 'rape seed' is calculated to be circa 7.60E-02 kg. Fertiliser/s used in this dataset is/are: 'ammonia, liquid', 'ammonium nitrate, as N', 'ammonium sulfate, as N', 'lime', 'nitrogen fertiliser, as N', 'phosphate fertiliser, as P2O5', 'potassium chloride, as K2O', 'potassium sulfate, as K2O', 'urea, as N'. The total amount of active substance/s is doubled in order to account for the packaging of the dilluted product of fertiliser/s that is/are applied. Therefore, 1.52E-01 kg of packaging for fertilisers is justified with this exchange.

exchanges.description:
The exchange has been updated from 'potassium chloride, as K2O' into 'potassium chloride' and therefore its amount has been scaled (multiplied) from 0.0044 kg by 1.5829 kg of 'potassium chloride' per kg of 'potassium chloride, as K2O'. Original comment of the exchange is: Amount is determined from the mineral nutrient used for the crop and from the overall mineral fertilizers sales, by type of fertilizer, in Québec for agriculture (APNC, 2010). See details for disaggregation in supporting documentation '01 crop production - Québec.pdf' available on ecoinvent reports web page (https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/File/Reports).
The potash domestic market in Canada is supplied almost exclusively by domestic production and Quebec resellers of potassium chloride have a preferential trade agreement for supplying fertilizer from Canadian producers. Hence, potassium chloride used in quebec does not rely on the global market and a direct link to Canadian potassium chloride is used. Sources: 1) personnal communication with Gilles Lavoie from the Quebec Professional Association in Crop Nutrition and the Coop Fédérée Inc. (2013); 2) Temple Scott Associates inc. (2013). Fertilizer report for the Canadian Fertilizer Industry. April 5, 2013, 10 p. http://www.cfi.ca/_documents/Fertilizer%20Industry%20Report-%20FINAL.pdf

exchanges.description: Calculated value. Land use change (LUC) combines land transformation areas calculated with the adapted 'Direct Land Use Change Assessment Tool' version 2014 developed by Blonk Consultants and the carbon losses from soil organic carbon (SOC) and vegetation (VEG) as calculated in ecoinvent v3. See 'WFLDB-Guidelines.pdf', available at https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/File/Reports.

exchanges.description: Total amount of active substance/s of pesticides needed for the production of rape seed is calculated to be circa 3.08E-03 kg. Pesticide/s used in this dataset is/are: '[thio]carbamate-compound', 'benzo[thia]diazole-compound', 'borax, anhydrous, powder', 'glyphosate', 'metolachlor', 'pesticide, unspecified'. The total amount of active substance/s is doubled in order to account for the packaging of the dilluted product of pesticide/s that is/are applied. Therefore, 6.15E-03 kg of packaging for pesticides is justified with this exchange.

exchanges.description: Proxy value, based on soybean production data. Modelled with PestLCI 2.0. See supporting documentation '01 crop production - Québec.pdf' available on ecoinvent reports web page (https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/File/Reports).

NH3 from mineral fertilisers are calculated with the emission factors published in the EMEP guidelines from the European Environment Agency (EEA, 2013). NH3 from manure are calculated according to the caracteristics of every manure, and to Quebec figures for period and method of maqnure application, and delay before incorporation of manure into the soil (Parent et Gagné, 2010; 2013). See supporting documentation '01 crop production - Québec.pdf' available on ecoinvent reports web page (https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/File/Reports).

exchanges.description: Carbon dioxide emissions from limestone and urea application calculated from C content (IPCC, 2006). Emission factors are EF=1.57 kg CO2/kg N for urea, and EF=0.44 kg CO2/kg CaCO3 for limestone. See supporting documentation '01 crop production - Quebec.pdf' available on ecoinvent reports web page (https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/File/Reports).
